{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms, such as fever, rash, bilateral conjunctival injection, erythema of the tongue and lips, and a maculopapular rash involving the hands, feet, perineum, and trunk, suggest mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome (MLNS) without exanthema.
